Description: A pottery flask modelled as a bunch of grapes, with a short cylindrical mouth and a simple moulded rim. Three-piece mould, with some manipulation to hide the joins. Micaceous brown Nile silt.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in the Fayum. Ptolemaic or Roman, first century BC/AD. Comparanda: For better-modelled grape flasks, see: Allen 1985: no. 131, from Karanis, dated first century AD or earlier; Besques 1992: no. D/E 4554, from Middle Egypt, dated late Hellenistic; Breccia 1934: pl. cviii:621; Fischer 1994: no. 1251, dated Roman period; Fjeldhagen 1995: no. 207, dated first century BC/AD; Kaufmann 1913: fig. 123: 1; Schreiber 1908: 231, fig. 163, from Alexandria; Van Wijngaarden 1958: no. 99.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3783)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
